prTitle: feat: install and configure core dependencies
prBody:
## Summary

Implemented the core project setup for the lingerie website:

### âœ… Completed Tasks
- âœ… Initialized Vite + React project with proper structure
- âœ… Installed react-router-dom and added to package.json dependencies  
- âœ… Configured vite.config.js with comprehensive path aliases:
  - `@/` â†’ `./src`
  - `@/components` â†’ `./src/components`
  - `@/pages` â†’ `./src/pages`
  - `@/data` â†’ `./src/data`
  - `@/services` â†’ `./src/services`
  - `@/utils` â†’ `./src/utils`
  - `@/hooks` â†’ `./src/hooks`
  - `@/styles` â†’ `./src/styles`
- âœ… Set up vendor chunking for React dependencies in build configuration
- âœ… Created HTML entry point with proper meta tags and basic structure
- âœ… Verified build process works successfully with `npm run build`
- âœ… Tested path alias resolution with sample components and routing
- âœ… Set up basic React Router implementation to demonstrate functionality

### ğŸ§ª Testing Results
- âœ… Build process completes successfully
- âœ… Path aliases resolve correctly in imports
- âœ… Development server starts without errors
- âœ… Vendor chunking works as expected (react-vendor chunk created)
- âœ… Basic routing functionality operational

### ğŸ“ Files Created/Modified
- `package.json` - Added dependencies and build scripts
- `vite.config.js` - Path aliases and build optimization
- `index.html` - HTML entry point with meta tags
- `src/main.jsx` - React application entry point
- `src/App.jsx` - Main app component with routing
- `src/App.css` & `src/index.css` - Basic styling
- `public/vite.svg` - Default favicon
- Basic project structure created

The project is now ready for feature development with a solid foundation.

Closes #65
